items.message: Water levels in the Eastern Yar are near their normal levels and there is little risk of flooding in the immediate future. However, the river’s base flow is now a little higher since the recent exceptional rainfall. At Alverstone the level is only slowly receding but is unlikely to cause property flooding. At Sandown levels continue to fall allowing low lying flood affected land, ditches, cycle tracks and access paths to drain along the lower Yar Valley. Golf Links and Moreton Common Road will be clear of flooding. Today’s forecast has a low likelihood for some heavy showers this afternoon. Most places will see little rainfall totals but a few isolated locations could experience up to 20 to 30mm in a short time. This will continue into Monday and Tuesday. The river will be sensitive to significant rainfall and further rain may cause some surface water ponding or briefly increase river levels but should not cause out of bank flooding. We will monitor the weather and reissue an alert if the forecast changes.

The River Uck is high and rising. It is estimated that in only a few hours of Sunday afternoon, about a month's worth of rain (50mm) fell at the top of the Uck catchment. From 19:30 01/08/2021 flooding could affect fields, rural roads, gardens and approach riverside properties through Buxted, near the White Hart pub and areas around Hempstead Mill on Hempstead Lane, Uckfield. Areas in Uckfield most at risk from 21:00 include The Roller Mill, Mill Lane, River Way, Bridge Cottage & Bell Walk. From 23:00 flood water could approach properties at Isfield Mill and Isfield Bridge. Light rain should clear the area by 23:00 and the river should begin to fall by 02:00 Monday 2/8/2021 in Buxted, and 10:00 2/8/2021 in Isfield. Only small amounts of rain are forecast next week so the river should return to normal Monday afternoon. Please take proactive action to help reduce the impact of flooding. Flood protection products are recommended to be installed, if you have them. We will continue to monitor the river levels and forecasts. We will update this message by 10:00 02/08/2021.
